content:
Check:
  any:
    - name: --CAT
      operator: non_empty
    - all:
        - name: --DECOD
          operator: non_empty
        - name: --CAT
          operator: equal_to
          value: --DECOD
    - all:
        - name: --BODSYS
          operator: non_empty
        - name: --CAT
          operator: equal_to
          value: --BODSYS
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SENDIG.47
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error when --CAT is not null and --CAT is equal to --DECOD or
  --SCAT is equal to -BODSYS
Outcome:
  Message: --CAT is equal to --DECOD
  Output Variables:
    - --CAT
    - --DECOD
    - --BODSYS
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SENDIG
        Version: '3.1'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SENDIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '47'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Values for --CAT and --SCAT should not be redundant
                  with the domain or dictionary classification provided by --DECOD
                  and --BODSYS.
                Document: IG v.3.1
                Section: 4.2.6
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Trigger error when --CAT is not null and --CAT is equal to --DECOD or --SCAT is equal to -BODSYS

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Values for --CAT and --SCAT should not be redundant with the domain or dictionary classification provided by --DECOD and --BODSYS.
